item.title: Golang for Pythonistas
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Oct. 20, 2014 - Alexandre Bourget presents Go (an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software) to Pythonistas.

Useful links:

  • Go: http://golang.org/
  • Alexandre: http://sflx.ca/abourget
  • MP49: http://sflx.ca/mp49e
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://sflx.ca/jobs
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Bourget

item.title: System provisioning with Ansible -- a live demo
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Jan. 21, 2013 - Alexandre Bourget presents Ansible, an open-source software platform for configuring and managing computers.

Useful links:

  • Ansible: http://ansible.cc/ + https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ansible_(software)
  • Alexandre: http://blog.abourget.net/
  • MP34: http://montrealpython.org/2013/01/mp34/
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://www.savoirfairelinux.com
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Bourget

item.title: Gevent-socketio, cross-framework real-time web live demo
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Oct. 22, 2012 - Alexandre Bourget presents gevent-socketio, a cross-framework Python implementation of the Socket.IO protocol, based on gevent's cooperative concurrency model. Alexandre is the maintainer of the project. In this talk, he's performing a live demo of the capabilities of this framework by building Google Analytics in 45 minutes.

Useful links:

  • Gevent-socketio: https://github.com/abourget/gevent-socketio
  • MP32: http://montrealpython.org/2012/10/mp32/
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://www.savoirfairelinux.com
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Bourget

item.title: Gevent-socketio, cross-framework real-time web live demo
item.description:
Summary

gevent-socketio is the cross-framework python implementation of the Socket.IO protocol, based on Gevent's cooperative concurrency model. Alexandre Bourget is the maintainer of the project.

In this talk, we're going to have a live demo of its capabilities building Google Analytics in 45 minutes, with some AngularJS on the front-end, and other cool integrations.

Black chocolate will await you.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Bourget
